art gallery

Battle Painter

vasily vereshchagin

The Apotheosis of War

26.10.1842 - 13.04.1904

synopsis

vasily vereshchagin
was one of the most famous Russian war artists and one of the first Russian artists to be widely recognised abroad. The graphic nature of his realist scenes led to many of them never being printed or exhibited.

In the Paris Salon of 1866, Vereshchagin exhibited a drawing of Dukhobors chanting their Psalms. In the next year, he was invited to accompany General Konstantin Kaufman expedition to Turkestan. He was granted the rank of ensign. His heroism at the siege of Samarkand from June 2â€“8, 1868 resulted an award of the Cross of St George.
